resources.string: Duration of each POI (25 by default)

string.name: inst_send_POI_tittle
string.u: Instructions to send a POI to Liquid Galaxy system:

resources.string: 1. Check whether all the settings are correct by making click on ‘Settings’ option inside the menu located on the main screen’s top right corner. If they are incorrect, modify them. The settings to check are: user name, password, host IP and port.\n2. After checking settings correctness, you are able to select one POI to watch it in LG screens.\n

string.name: inst_send_TOUR_tittle
string.u: Instructions to send a Tour to Liquid Galaxy system:

resources.string:
1. Check whether all the settings are correct by making click on ‘Settings’ option inside the menu located on the main screen’s top right corner. If they are incorrect, modify them. The settings to check are: user name, password, host IP and port.
2. After checking settings correctness, you are able to select one POI to watch it in LG screens.
3. To stop the Tour view in the LG screens, click on the red STOP button located on the bottom right corner of the main screen.

It has two functionalities: the first and most used works in order to add a new item (POI, Tour or Category) inside the data base; the other is used to add an existing POI inside a Tour when the administration user is creating or updating it.
Its functionality is to edit one existing item, being a POI, Tour or Category.
Cancels any operation which could consists in creating, updating, adding…
Removes an existing item, being a POI, Tour or Category.
Confirms one action as creating or updating one item.
Stops the Tours view on one Liquid Galaxy system.
It is used to add one item (POI, Tour or Category) inside the category which is current shown in the screen, better said, it is added inside the category that the user is seeing on the screen.
When user clicks on it, the place written inside the field of the left side is searched in the Liquid Galaxy system.

To be able to import POIs, you must keep an eye on the following mandatory steps, but I firstly have to say that the importation process would be absolutely effective or not depending on the file explorer you use. The once that always works is the once called Root Explorer: Root Explorer Download

1. Create one folder and put some place-marks in Google Earth corresponding on the POIs you want to save.
2. Save that place (foler with all POIs) and export it with a kmz extension.
3. Extract the doc.kml file which is inside the kmz that you have just created.
4. Download and execute the script of the following link: KML to query.txt by typing in a console: sh kml2query.sh doc.kml
5. Now you get a query.txt file. This file contains your POIs. Finally, you only have to change its name and set the Category name where you want the POIs to be saved.
6. Save that CATEGORY_NAME.txt file inside your device.
7. After these steps, go to your LGPC app, travel to the Administration Tools section and click on IMPORT POIS button.
8. Select your file explorer, preferably Root Explorer once, and select the X.txt file you want to import.
All the complete information to help you with the Liquid Galaxy POIs Controller correct use is in: Liquid Galaxy POIs Controller Wiki\n
Choose the way you want to import POIS

The name must not be empty
Global interval (in seconds) for each POI
Error connecting with Liquid Galaxy. Please, try changing settings.
Error reading POIs. Remember POI name must be between two \'@\' and other features between \'<featureName>\' fields.
Select a Logo for this task
Search some place on Liquid Galaxy…
The attributes \'Longitude, Latitude, Altitude, Heading, Tilt and Range\' must have numeric values.
This category already exists. Modify the attribute \'Name\'
Name field can\'t be empty. Please, write a name for the Tour.
The duration of each POI must be in seconds (numeric type).
You must type a global POI interval in seconds.
Run the script stored in the task with its configuration, if specified. If not, it takes the global configuration of the app
If the task has been executed before, it runs the shutdown script stored in the task

Task title: The task Title

 Task Description:The task description

 Execution Script:The script executed when the task is launched

 Upload Execution Script:Upload a file containing the run script

 Shutdown Script:The Script executed when the task is stopped

 Upload Shutdown Script:Upload a file containing the stop script

 IP where launch the task:The IP of the server where the task should be executed. If no specified, then the default value from the application setting will be used

 SSH UserName:The username to connect to the server via ssh. If no specified, then the default value from the application setting will be used

 SSH Password:The password to connect to the server via ssh. If no specified, then the default value from the application setting will be used

 Open Browser URL:If specified, when the task finishes its initial script, a web browser pointing to this URL will be opened

 Select a Logo for this task:Offers the possibility to upload an image associated with this task that will be displayed next to the task title in the list

 Save:Save the task

 Cancel:Cancel and close the dialog
